Key Match Events: Chris Jordan took 3 wickets for 37 runs
Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets for 19 runs
Axar Patel took 3 wickets for 23 runs
Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav put on a 73-run partnership for the third wicket
Jofra Archer was dismissed lbw by Jasprit Bumrah for 21 runs
Post-Match Reflections: India's quest for a world title is well on course. It's been 11 years since they stood on the podium as champions. Now all that separates them from glory is a few hours' time and a fiery South African team.

Rohit Sharma and his men dismantled the defending champions England in the T20 World Cup 2024 semi-final, bowling them out for a mere 103 after first whacking them around to make 171 in Providence, Guyana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a slow and low-bounce pitch in Providence, Guyana
The game was interrupted by rain, consuming 153 minutes of the game's time
England's last recognised batter, Liam Livingstone, was run-out after a mix-up with the lower order
